reviews.name: GE 30-Pint Dehumidifier  ADEW30LQ
reviews.reviewText:
This review is based on approx 1 month of usage only

It seems to work well in an area the size of a fairly large living room. It's super easy to operate. Almost no setup required for this equipment, just removing tape (and connecting a garden hose if you decide to do that).

The water collection bucket only holds a gallon of water. It does have a way to hook a garden hose up to it, but I haven't gotten around to it yet. Emptying and replacing the water collection bin is a cinch!

The drawback is that it's VERY LOUD (much louder than my previous dehumidifier), so you will not want it running if you are trying to sleep or watch TV on same floor level. [If your basement is very large or and sectioned off with walls, you will probably need more than 1 unit. Two of these would be way too noisy to deal with.]

The beep/alarm that is supposed to let you know when the water bin is full and the unit has stopped running is NOT loud at all so I find that feature useless.

It was pretty heavy for me to lug into my house and down into the basement - so if you're a lightweight or elderly, you'll probably want help for that.

The filter is just a little screen that's pretty much like a lint filter on a clothes dryer - very easy to remove and replace - appears to be easily cleaned (haven't had to clean it yet).
reviews.title: Works well, but it's loud

reviews.name: GE 30-Pint Dehumidifier  ADEW30LQ
reviews.reviewText: Live in a basement apartment and this is a lifesaver. Didn't have one last year and had mold all over the place. I have to empty it 2X a day but its much easier than cleaning up mold.
reviews.title: 17 June 2012

reviews.name: GE 30-Pint Dehumidifier  ADEW30LQ
reviews.reviewText: Does a great job of replacing the 18 year old unit that I did have. Only problem I have with it, is it runs all the time. Not sure how that is an energy saver.
reviews.title: Does the job for being a smaller unit.

reviews.name: GE 30-Pint Dehumidifier  ADEW30LQ
reviews.reviewText: This product is good if you don't want to connect a hose to have it drain, the connector in the machine is located so tight you can't get in to it to screw on the hose connector unless your a plumber with lots of tools. Also doesn't tell you what % to set it at.
reviews.title: 28 May 2012

reviews.name: GE 30-Pint Dehumidifier  ADEW30LQ
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for a replacement unit to run in a rental apartment. It will be used in a basement level apartment and in Ohio, that means moisture! It has some features that the last one didn't have - you can adjust the percentage of humidity, you can set a shut-off timer for 2 or 4 hours. It has an external water level guide, so you can see if it is getting close to time to empty, or if there is a lot of room left. That is a nice feature. I think it is a good unit; time will tell, and it will get much use in the basement, because there is a good deal of moisture there in the summer. I need something dependable there, and I hope that this holds up well. I have had this for about 2 months now, and no complaints. Seems to run quieter than the old one too.
reviews.title: Satisfied
